description:
#UkraineRussiaCrisis | Airbnb’s chief executive has said the company is working with its hosts to house up to 100,000 refugees fleeing Ukraine for free.

Brian Chesky announced the move in a series of tweets on Monday morning.

He wrote: “Airbnb and Airbnb.org are working with our Hosts to house up to 100,000 refugees fleeing from Ukraine, for free.

“We need help to meet this goal. The greatest need we have is for more people who can offer their homes in nearby countries, including Poland, Germany, Hungary and Romania. If you can host a refugee, go here: airbnb.org/get-involved.”

He added: “All stays are free for refugees, funded by Airbnb, Airbnb.org donors and through the generosity of Hosts.”

The United Nations says over 360,000 refugees have fled Ukraine since Vladimir Putin launched his attack last week.

#Airbnb #accomodation #Ukrainerefugee #RussiaUkraineConflict #ukraine #NortheastToday

Wenn du Wohnraum für Ukraineflüchtlinge in Österreich anbieten kannst, melde dich BITTE!

Tausende Frauen und Kinder suchen ein Dach über dem Kopf. 😔

Hier hast du einige Adressen, an die du dich ganz unbürokratisch wenden kannst:
 
 
immo-hilft.at 
(Initiative der österreichischen Immobilien-Branche gemeinsam mit der Caritas) @immo_hilft 
 
homesforukraine.eu 
(gemeinnützige, öffentliche Organisationen Barbareum, Unlimited Democracy, TUMA, ukrainische Kirchengemeinde St. Barbara in Wien) 
 
warhelp.eu 
(Auf dieser Website ist es möglich, nicht nur einen Wohnraum zur Verfügung zu stellen, sondern auch Fahrdienste oder jegliche Art von Freiwilligendienst anzubieten)
 
de.airbnb.org/help-ukraine 
(Gastgeber:innen der Plattform können ihre Unterkunft kostenlos oder zu einem ermäßigten Preis anbieten, um Menschen aus der Ukraine zu helfen) @airbnb 

volkshilfe-wien.at 
(nationale und internationale Hilfsorganisation) @volkshilfe_wien 

Via Mail: nachbarschaftsquartier@bbu.gv.at (Koordinierungsstelle des Innenministeriums)

Day 8. 

My grandma who is now 84, was a young girl during WWII and experienced first hand war stories, remembers everything that happened during those few years and all the aftermath following. It’s been 8 days now, enough to turn people’s lives/families upside down.

But we’ve been seeing so many people coming together and trying to help in any way they can.  Getting funds, gathering medicine, supplies, clothes, shoes, blankets, anything that may be of need for refugees or civilians currently stuck in Ukraine. 

#standwithukraine
#stopputin
#stoprussianaggression

There’s been a few people constantly providing places/pages that can help with information or ways you can help:
@simonaevna
@glblctzn

Helping house refugees:
Airbnb.org/help-Ukraine

Volunteer Crisis Response: 
https://www.criout.com

#illustration#art#drawukrainemv#dark#darkart#doll#ukrainiandoll#artwork#ukraine

Our action - even the smallest one - can make a difference. 

This is why we decided to promote @airbnb incredible project to welcome and support the Ukrainian people. You can book a room in Ukraine’s neighbouring countries and offer it for free to refugees escaping or book a room in Ukraine to financially help people in need. 

Find how to do it clicking the link in the stories or below:
https://it.airbnb.org/help-ukraine?_set_bev_on_new_domain=1646750469_ODA1Mzg3NmM4YjQ2

#Ukraine 💛💙

Do you want to help those who have to flee Ukraine because of the war? Thanks to IOM and Airbnb.org initiative, you can now provide them with temporary 🏡 accommodation through Airbnb.org for free or at a discount.

How does it work?
👉 You provide an apartment with a bed and basic amenities for anywhere from a few days to a few weeks.
👉 Airbnb.org works with IOM and other non-profits that check refugee guests for eligibility and assist them before, during, and after their stays.
👉 Airbnb provides Hosts with AirCover (insurance, damage protection, etc.).

In which countries can you provide accommodations?
🇵🇱 Poland,
🇲🇩 Moldova,
🇷🇴 Romania,
🇭🇺 Hungary, and
🇸🇰 Slovakia.

Airbnb.org will offer free, short-term housing to up to 100,000 people fleeing Ukraine.

📌 Anyone who wants to open their heart and doors to accommodate people can find out more at the link – https://www.airbnb.org/help-ukraine 

! Direct link in profile bio

Incredible. CEO @bchesky and @Airbnb have been providing housing and funds to refugees fleeing Ukraine. Brian and co-founders, Joe, Nathan & his wife Elizabeth are matching up to $10 million in donations for those in need. You can help support here: airbnb.org/help-ukraine

A real reason to be inspired this Friday: Recently I’ve been asking friends “do we have any national heroes?” Meaning in these totally partisan, chaotic times, are there any people we can all agree are heroic? Today I think we can all agree the people of Ukraine are superheroes. The grit, the determination, and the love of freedom found in Ukraine is astounding. I don’t know if I would do the same. These heroes challenge me to approach my life with more gratitude and more courage.
.
The first photo is of president Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who when offered the opportunity to flee Ukraine, said “ I don’t need a ride, I need more ammunition.”
.
The next photo is of school teachers in Ukraine ready to go into battle, risking their lives for freedom.
.
And the last is of people in Russia standing up against their government, risking jail time and suppression.
.
To all of my readers in Ukraine, you inspire us and set an example that ordinary people can be extraordinarily brave.
.
I will continue to be a witness, not to look away from this atrocity and to do what I can. Today what I can do is donate to https://www.airbnb.org to help house refugees. It’s not enough but it’s a start. 
.
Love,
T$
